data.title: Pizza 73 Launches Powerhouse Potato Wedges, Poutine and Thick and Rich Chili Just in Time for Grey Cup, Winter Season
data.meta_description: Pizza 73, one of Western Canada's leading quick-serve restaurant chains, has scored a touchdown of taste with the launch of its two new signature menu items: chili and poutine. Launched Monday throughout ...
data.text:
EDMONTON, ALBERTA--(Marketwired - Nov 19, 2013) - Pizza 73, one of Western Canada's leading quick-serve restaurant chains, has scored a touchdown of taste with the launch of its two new signature menu items: chili and poutine. Launched Monday throughout the Pizza 73 network of 73 restaurants, the two new menu items are made from the freshest ingredients carefully sourced to provide best taste, quality and value. The chili is blended with seasoned ground beef, kidney beans, green peppers, tomatoes and onions and sells for the low price of $3.99. The poutine features Pizza 73's crispy potato wedges covered in premium cheese curds and hot, delicious gravy for $4.99.

"We've always believed we're in the business of making people happy through quality food that can be eaten on the go or in social settings," said Pat Finelli, Chief Marketing Officer for Pizza 73. "Based on feedback to date, we're confident our chili and poutine will bring warm smiles to consumers who are looking for new options."

With a strong roster of popular menu items like flavourful pizzas, saucy and meaty wings, curly fries and potato wedges, Pizza 73's latest menu expansion reflects a growing demand from the lunch crowd as well feedback from loyal pizza fans who are looking to score points with family and friends who may prefer options beyond the traditional pizza pie.

"Choice is important to us because it's on the minds of our customers," said Finelli. "Our customers have their plates full trying to meet the diverse eating preferences of their family members, teammates or colleagues. We want them to know they can find options that taste good at affordable prices whether they come in for lunch or order from us for dinner."

Visit www.Pizza73.com for more information or consult the company's Facebook page for a friendly popularity contest/showdown between chili and poutine.
